hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Dawn Patrol Softshell Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Warmer than shell pants and she heat better than gore-Tex. Love the pockets and boot cuffs. Very flexible and suspenders are a must when having a backpack.
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody: I tired of overheating in goretex and these are ideal for my ski touring missions. I run hot and needed something more breathable. Great natural breath ability, vents and pockets. I plan to use them all season and see how they hold up to New England's varied terrain! Thanks BD!
review.name: Fantastic ski pants!

review.reviewBody:
Great materials, fit, pockets. Great weight for Colorado touring and ski mountaineering in everything but the wettest of the wet. 
But, where are you supposed to clip your beacon? Strangely, the Recon pants - which are more resort oriented - have a beacon clip in the pocket. Best I can do with these is girth hitch around a belt loop, which is not ideal. What are people doing with their beacon in these pants?
review.name: Very nice, but...

review.reviewBody: 6’3” 220lbs XL fits perfect - higher quality materials and attention to detail - also love the color -
review.name: Excellent quality and fit

review.reviewBody: My go to touring pants. I toured in goretex bibs for years and it wasn’t till I gave these a whirl that I realized how much more efficient stretchy, soft shell pants are. I ended up cutting the mesh out of the vents for more airflow which I do not regret. They hold up in anything from stormy PNW mid winter tours to warm, vert heavy spring days. I would give them 5 stars if they had an inner set of thigh vents but oh well. I’m 5’7 with a 32 waist and medium's fit great.
review.name: Love em

review.reviewBody:
Pretty excited about the fit on these pants and I think they are mostly going to work great. There are however a few major things that I would personally change if I could. First is an anchor point in the right thigh pocket for a beacon. I personally have never been a fan of the padded Pieps pockets for touring, but a simple loop would be lovely. 
Second is an issue with how the seams come together around the vent zip at the knee. It feel like it's created a ton of material in that one spot and I'm mildly concerned that they are going to rub and become uncomfortable on longer warm day tours with just boxers on underneath.
All in all a great pant so far, and I don't even feel like the suspenders are necessary.
review.name: Initial impression

review.reviewBody:
Light weight, breathable, stretchable. I love back country skiing, cycling, and playing hockey. So let's just say that I have a big can. These pants fit perfectly and move with me. The built in suspenders are a must and they work flawlessly. 
Hands down, the best pair of ski pants that I have ever owned (40+ years of trials to reference). Thanks BD!
review.name: Perfect for Back Country!!

review.reviewBody:
Using these pants was awesome, the fit is great pockets are well placed. They move well, made skinning and skiing and skiing a breeze. Breathable and stayed dry. 
The only major knock is the material didn't hold up well to use. After one day of skiing found several small cuts and blemishes in the material.
review.name: Awesome fit, function and Breathable, durability seems below average

review.reviewBody: Just used for a few days, but they fit me so well, warm, durable and flexible. Good pairs to use on colder days.
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody: Haven’t used them too much, but have loved the initial feeling. Most comfortable snow pants I’ve ever owned. Plenty of pocket space. I’m not too sure on the durability as I haven’t used them too much.
review.name: Great for back country

name: Dawn Patrol Softshell Pant - Men's

hasVariant.name: B2-R Travel Case
hasVariant.description: Buy the Orucase B2-R Travel Case online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have hard plastic cases, but they are huge. I bought the Orucase for biking in Europe. The case fit my tour bike and the 2 racks. You do have to fully disassemble the bike to pack it, including removing the fork, but its not rocket science. The bikes arrived unscathed, and we didn't get a humongous bill for oversized luggage. Also, when we were riding my wife and I were able to put one case inside of the other so only had to store one bag while touring.
review.name: Smallest Case around

name: B2-R Travel Case

review.reviewBody:
I'm so disappointed.  I have a smaller USWE and have been very happy with the it, I wanted to upgrade to a larger unit, after unboxing this hydration vest ( RUSH 8)  I noticed that the front pockets are made of a fabric that looks like panty hose material which I know will snag
Easily and will distort with any weight even if it's just a snack,  I was hoping it would be a mesh like fabric just like the other part of the vest. I didn't even try it on, I will exchange it for a different one.
review.name: Dissatisfied

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago and it has worked very well. The features are great, the pockets are plenty, fits very well and does not rub your chest like backpack straps do. The hydration bladder is sufficient and bite. Valve is good as well. It definitely does not jump around on your back. If I did have one complaint, it would be the color – I wish it were something other than black. I’m average size dude, 5’11” 185lbs. Fits great.
review.name: Perfect setup for extra water on trail

review.reviewBody: Great product. Light, comfortable, good quality and design. Plenty of space. I even use this on my road rides.
review.name: Good for Long distance rides

name: Rush 8L Hydration Pack

hasVariant.name: 2-Day Assault 27L Daypack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch 2-Day Assault 27L Daypack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I've spent an insane amount of time with my first 2 DAP, and this is my second one. They're my go to for rucking light loads, and they'll handle 35-40lbs all day without issue. If I wanna push past 40lbs, I switch to a larger external frame pack. As a side note, I was an 11C early on in GWOT, so rucking stupid loads isn't something I'm new to, YMMV.

Cheers
review.name: One of my faves

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack specifically for commuting to and from work to carry my laptop, tablet, and my other electronics (power banks, lights, cords), in addition to design tools and first aid items. I typically am in the weather for as many as twenty minutes per day - and in northwest Washington in the winter, that's a guarantee that it will be raining. Additionally, I sometimes have to “bushwack” past trees and blackberry vines as I weave around cars to get to my office. This pack is tough and water resistant enough that I have no fear of anything getting wet or damaged. The adjustable yoke and plastic frame make this extremely comfortable. The interior dump pockets are perfect for all those things that make a portable office work as I’m commuting on the ferry. The compression straps keep everything in place no matter what. I am 100 percent sold on the value of this pack. I recommend it to anyone needing a solid commuting backpack that could easily double for a quick weekend wilderness escape.
review.name: A Perfect Bomb Proof Pack

review.reviewBody: Great all around pack from hunting to day hikes. Built well as all mystery ranch products are. Don’t hesitate on this one.
review.name: Bad to the bone

review.reviewBody: I purchased this bag as a day pack for a longer backpacking trip. The pocket placement is well thought out and easy to access, especially with the Y-zipper. It still looked brand new upon arriving back home, resisting dirt, rain, snow and stains throughout my trip. I loved this pack so much I bought one for my husband as soon as we got back.
review.name: Versatile and durable

review.reviewBody: I can’t complain about quality. Only issue is the mobile version ordering process does not make clear that there are two different sized bags. I got the S/M and now wish I had gotten the next size bigger. I had no idea the shoulder strap system would be labeled as such. When I ordered a 2-day bag, I thought the size (volume) would be standard for 2-day vs a larger 3-day bag.
review.name: Quality and Craftsmanship 5 Stars

review.reviewBody: I have had this for about a month. So far it has been awesome. I love the trizip for access or bucket style pack. Very beefy zippers. A little stiff at first but I’m sure they will loosen up some. Very well built and durable. I have wanted a mystery ranch pack for years and so far I am not disappointed.
review.name: Awesome EDC or day pack

review.reviewBody: Overall it’s a good bag but I’m not a fan of all the Molle on the front. Wish they would make a 2dap with little to no Molle.
review.name: Decent

review.reviewBody:
Seems like a decent pack but the coyote color was far darker than in any review videos, pictures and promo that I saw online before purchasing. Did not match any coyote brown gear that I own. Material was also a little shiny and not matte. 
Ended up returning to look for something else, maybe from the US made line. Wish I would have remembered to take pics. Pack had a April 2024 manufacturing date.
review.name: Coyote color does not match pictures or videos

review.reviewBody: I've had the bag for a month now and I do not know how I functioned before this bag. I take it to work everyday and it has made my life so easy. I keep it in the passenger seat on road trips and my truck seems so much more organized now.
review.name: I don't know how I functioned before

review.reviewBody: I have used my Assault 2 pack on a few of my day hikes. It rides well and is very comfortable. I like the sleek clean lines and will be using it for carry-on when I fly. I esp like the side zipper to get to my laptop. It will make going through TSA a lot easier. To sum up— a great pack. Glad I bought it. As a side note, a long time ago I had a Dana Bomb pack. I loved that pack. After learning Mystery Ranch had past connections w/ Dana, I knew I was getting a super pack.
review.name: Comfortable Fit

name: 2-Day Assault 27L Daypack

review.reviewBody: After much research, reading reviews and comparisons, considering cost, weight, comfort, durability, I settled on this for my backpacking pillow.  I was super impressed with how small and lightweight it was.  That is where my joy ended.  When I put my head on this to test it out, it was too tall and hard fully inflated, so I let some air out.  Immediately it became noisy/crinkly and was still too hard.  I made several inflation adjustments and when I let out about half the air I thought I'd found a comfortable position.  The moment I moved, though, all bets were off...my head would roll/bounce on the air.  I absolutely could not find a comfortable position on this pillow and had a neck ache from trying to test it.  I'm a back sleeper, so this is a hard pass for me.  One note, I did roll to my side and found it more "comfortable" but still not adequate to get a good night's sleep - returning.  At the price point and the reviews I read, I expected more.
review.name: Thoroughly Disappointed

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wanted to have a small travel pillow to use when I am housesitting. I can be away from home from a week to a month at a time and that is a long time to deal with pillows that are not comfortable to use. The Aeros has been perfect! I recently used it on a two-week stay. I filled it once and did not need to adjust it the entire time. I am very happy with this purchase!
review.name: Great little pillow!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My second one! Better than ever. Love how small it folds up in your bag.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable. Packs up small. Only got to try it indoors. 7 more months of winter before I can truly try it out.
review.name: Very comfortable. Packs up small.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super comfortable! I wish I would have bought this a long time ago. Super lightweight and much better than a puffy jacket stuffed in a shirt.
review.name: Super comfortable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ive use sea to summit products for years. I love the pillows. so light, durable and comfy. I used my pillow to sleep and float in the water with. I did have one pillow stitching come loose and they resolved the issue fast,
review.name: Awsome products and great coustomer service. which is hard to come by these days.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I needed to replace my Sea to Summit pillow due to an age failure with the air reservoir. The company was great, addressed my need and request, and has helped me keep Sea to Summit a camping essential.
review.name: Pillow

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this pillow, I use it for back country camping and airline travel
review.name: Great little pillow!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] i purchased this pillow, One for me and one for my husband. they are much more comfortable than just a blow up pillow. The light padding/ down layer makes all the difference.
review.name: works!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm a side sleeper and have tried a couple different pillow options and always find them going missing, not thick enough or in other ways not satisfying. I've used this on two multi-night trips now and have been able to have such better sleeps than before. It packs down incredibly small and the curve gives it a really nice shape when inflated.
review.name: Side Sleepin' Satisfaction

name: Aeros Premium Pillow

They do run a full size smaller compared to other cotton or cotton blend brands. I'm 64 , and no pole vaulter from France but, they seem just a little snug in the privates when I sit down. description: Buy the Vasque Juxt Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Juxt Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Vasque Juxt Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe 2 years ago.  I've easily hiked, jogged, or walked in this shoes well over 1200 miles.  Any other shoe would have fallen apart.  This is the most sturdy shoe I've ever worn, while still being extremely comfortable to wear every day.  This is the shoe I put on after a long hike in my St. Elias boots.  So glad I found these shoes.
review.name: Best Shoe.....

review.reviewBody: Been a Vasque customer for decades, back when they were made in Italy, I was a bit hesitant to buy the Asian made sundowners I’ve grown to love from the mid 90’s. I was pleasantly surprised, they still have the perfect fit out of the box as they did in years past, to be honest I’ve never owned anything other than the sundowners, the juxt was the first different Vasque product I’ve bought, and I’m not disappointed! I may buy a second set for “date night” and another set for the trails!
review.name: NO BREAK IN NEEDED!
comment: Thank you for your review! I am glad to hear we have lived up to your expectations regarding the performance.  We hope that you continue to like the improvements and we can serve you in the future!  Thank you for your review!

review.reviewBody:
The heels of these soles fell apart in 14 months.
These were moderately used for day hiking and the heels fell apart. As you can see the rest of the soles have minimal wear. I have been hiking for over 45 years and have had plenty of hiking shoes, these are defective. Vasque would not cover them saying this damaged was caused by either chemicals or heat, wrong in both cases. If there was chemical or heat damaged wouldn't the rest of the sole look the same?
In my experience you can only trust a hiking shoe with a Vibram sole. These are a Vasque branded sole even though the specs say they are Vibram.
Vasque never again.
review.name: Soles fell apart
comment:
Hi, thanks for the review. We are sorry to hear you were not satisfied with these shoes. We did send these pictures over to our inspection team, and based on the pictures, it was determined that there was damage from heat or chemicals.

If you believe this wasn't the case, please send us another email from our prior conversation thread, and I will help you get these sent in for further evaluation.

review.reviewBody: I’ve bought 4 pair over the last several years hoping that if discontinued I’d be good.  Well I forgot about all my friend gifts etc.  This is duty tough shoe with amazing comfort and it can handle everything.  Please consider 1/2 sizes or wide sizes.
review.name: Juxt Best Outdoor Trail Shoe Ever Made and May it
comment: Thank you for your review. We will pass your suggestions along to the proper channels. We hope to serve you again in the future!

review.reviewBody: they are decently comfortable out of the box, but they are also not so comfortable on longer hikes with a daypack for 8 hours.  The main weakness of the Juxt is the Vibram Off-the-Grid (OTG) outsole, which lacks gripiness in mud and wet conditions.  The outsole does provide good protection on rocky and rugged terrain, though.  The other weakness is breathability.  There suede upper provides good protection in rugged terrain, but it also doesn't breathe well in hot weather.  The suede upper isn't very water repellant either.  The shoes do well in dry, rugged mid-temperature climates, for shorter duration, lighweight daypack hikes.  They are more comfortable with different insoles, which can up the comfort over longer duration hikes/backpacks.  One complaint in reviews I've seen concerns the exposed stitching between the bicolor suede seams, which cut easily when rubbed against over time or sharp objects like rocks, but that stitching appears more for aesthetics rather than function.  Vasque should have just omitted it and saved a half an ounce.  I haven't suffered a split where that stitching has fraid or been cut.  The stitching where it matters use either double stitching or heavier duty thread.  I still like the Juxt, but it isn't the wide range of applications shoe as marketed in the features, especially when things get a little drizzly.
review.name: overated hyped up, average shoe
comment: Thank you for your comments and suggestions. We hope to continue serving you in the future!

review.reviewBody: I’ve never had a pair of shoes last over 2 years wearing them every day. Everything about the Juxt is awesome.
review.name: Long lasting and comfortable
comment: I'm so glad your Juxts have treated you well! I hope we can continue serving you in the future.

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of these for my local hikes in the Santa Cruz mountains.  Great traction, super comfortable and toe protection is perfect, can't even feel rock or rut strikes.  Definitely buying again.
review.name: Excellent comfort, durability, and style!
comment: I'm so glad your Juxts are treating you well no matter the hike!

review.reviewBody: These shoes were comfortable right out of the box. I wear them almost daily for a 2-4 mile hike\walk. About 8 months in the stitching started to come undone on the side of the shoe. Still wear them because they are very comfortable but looking for something new
review.name: Comfortable hiking shoe but
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you. We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody: Love my Juxt shoes!  Sadly after wearing them for a year the rubber around the toes is separating from the shoe.  I would buy another pair anyways as they are sooo comfortable.  Unfortunately due to global shortages, finding them again in an 11.5 W has become impossible.
review.name: Comfortable Trail Shoe
comment: Thank you for the review! We appreciate your loyalty and support over the years!

review.reviewBody: I'd like to buy this shoe but my size (15) has been sold out or unavailable. I have Vasque hiking boots and I love them. When will Juxt be available in my size so I can try them? Thanks
review.name: Mens shoe size
comment: Thank you for the review! We appreciate your loyalty and support over the years! We are undergoing some back orders at this time, I suggest reaching out to your local store or contacting me directly at: abby.heath@redwingshoes.com

review.reviewBody: Great helmet; very comfortable, nice design, fits well, excellent protection
review.name: Great helmet

review.reviewBody: I was stoked to get something like this for better protection than the average cross country style MTB helmet. However it doesn’t fit my long oval head. Nice quality though, and I like the full adjustment visor.
review.name: Great helmet NOT for long oval heads

review.reviewBody:
There is plenty of venting; its light enough, and the vented ear coverage on the sides should be on all helmets! The strap has a quick-click connection making it easy and simple to strap in. Visor is adjustable. The ear coverage does not interfere with hearing. This helmet is suitable for mountain biking, gravel roads and even road riding. 

I have been mountain biking for over 30 years, and until GIro reworked the Switchblade, I wore an old-school BMX over the ears solid helmet, and have never overheated.I still wear it when its cool or cold. The Tyrant is only the 2nd actual mtn biking helmet I have owned.  Better coverage than the Fox Dropframe.   Get this Helmet!
review.name: The  Only Helmet You'll Ever Need

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This dock hangout was great for holding a lot of people who wanted to just "hangout" on the water. I had 6 people on it and it held all of us without submerging. The reason I gave it a 3 star is because the brown surface decking is not that sturdy. I only used it once, and somehow the deck got nicked. I was hoping that the deck would be more sturdier since it was rated for marine wear. Submitting pictures in varying light.
review.name: First time use flaw

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The hangout 240 is an awesome addition to your water toys. It allows you to relax with a group of friend. Ot durable and holds at least 4 people. Awesome product!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just got the 240 hang out. Couch could not be happier. Quality is excellent sturdiness excellent ease to inflate excellent it was great to put on the back of our boat swim deck to extend the space. I was nervous. The dogs weren’t gonna like it. They loved it so fun.. looking forward to sharing it with the whole family.

review.reviewBody:
From reading others reviews, I felt like ordering these gloves was going to be hit or miss.
Purchased for a bikepacking trip from Denver to Durango on the Colorado Trail. 

The good: Comfortable, great dexterity. Suitable to wear across a wide range of temperatures. Touch screen compatibility is fantastic.

The bad: Quality is marginal in the seams. Glove began to break down almost immediately, especially along the finger seams. I was able to patch them on a multi day trip, but it defiantly feels like these are "disposable" gloves that will have to be replaced after 10 days of full day use, not what you would expect from Giro.
review.name: Great Comfort - Spotty Quality

review.reviewBody: These are great, super lightweight, grippy and feel like they have enough protection.  Great gloves that I'll probably wear for mountain biking and road riding.  Good quality wool and the fit is great for x-large hands
review.name: Breezy, well put together

review.reviewBody: I like the glove for the fit and for the warmth of wool in cold wet conditions. However, I had a similar experience to some of the others who have left comments. They did not last. I noticed small holes in them within the first 4 days of starting to use them. I was touring (riding 5-10 hours a day) so they were getting a lot of use. By day 10 both thumbs had holes in them so my thumbs stuck through. By day 20 my index finger was beginning to stick through both gloves too. The picture is about 25 (long) days use. So, nice while they last, but they don't last very well.
review.name: nice while they last, they don't last

name: D'Wool Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is the fourth or fifth pair of these I have bought. They are my go to hikers and I hope they continue to make them.
review.name: My go to hikers

review.reviewBody:
I love these. They fit much more comfortably than most shoes and the arch isn't painful for my almost-flat feet.
One thing that's really important to know is that they run extremely small, and I do mean *extremely*. My normal street shoe size is a pretty solid 8, but 41.5 in these was too short. I sized up to a 42 because that was the largest size they had. They fit well, but if I went on a really long hike I think I would probably need to size up even more. I actually ordered mine from REI, but I see they have the next size up here.
review.name: Great for "low-volume" feet

review.itemreviewed: Speed Carbon RC Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve been looking for a shoe with a minimal drop, and that isn’t just foam. This shoe is perfect. It has excellent response when stepping off. I have a narrower foot and narrow heals. The tie system locks my heal in perfectly. The toe box isn’t super wide and the upper gives some support without adding weight. I absolutely love this shoe. I’ve been running for 40 years and am constantly dealing with shoes being discontinued. I pray Scott keeps this one around. I bought four pairs just in case. My husband, also a long time distance runner, bought two pair of the men’s. This shoe makes me happy.
review.name: Perfect shoe with minimal drop

name: Speed Carbon RC Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody:
For alpine starts, biking, crossing windy ridges, it's absolutely perfect. Probably the widest comfort range of any piece of clothing I own, it gives insulation where you get chilly and plenty of breathability everywhere else. Too warm for me uphill on anything but a brisk day, but otherwise basically perfect.

Definitely euro sized, go up one from the big north american brands and you'll be comfortable.
review.name: Might be the greatest layer ever made

review.reviewBody: Much more of a European cut - it doesn't balloon out around the body. The M fits a 5'11", 175 lb frame snugly but perfectly - you have to know what you're buying. It is thin as the 3 star reviewer noted. However it is very warm for its size (that said it is not a waterproof or windproof layer) - for that look at alternative products. This is a great for a breathable piece of kit. I literally wear it every day for the past 18 months.
review.name: Thin but warm

review.reviewBody:
I am lucky enough to have a robust gear closet. This is one of my favorite pieces. I wear this as an outer layer on cool hikes, skinning or around town or as a mid layer on colder days. 

Fits slim so great for layering, but not too trim. 

Highly recommend this jacket
review.name: Fantastic as outer or mid-layer

review.reviewBody: The design is very nice, But I think is overpriced for the fabric, very thin. If you return they will charge $7. Better to lose the return cost.
review.name: Overpriced for the texture
comment:
One of my favorite jackets 

I am lucky enough to have a sizable gear closet. I love this jacket. Great fit. I wear it as out otter later on cool skins, hiles and around town or as a mid-layer on colder activities.

name: Westalpen Swisswool Hybrid Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Super fly and comfortable, ASICS doesn’t miss, highly recommend
review.name: Super fly and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Love the shoe. White pair fit as expected. Black pair are slightly wider and I have to lace them very tight to make them hold my foot. Becomes uncomfortable after a while.
review.name: Unisex

review.reviewBody:
Very well-made and very comfortable sneakers. I wasn't impressed with the similar Reebok, Adidas, or Nike, which seem more like fashion over function. The Asics Japan feel like a true athletic/walking sneaker, but with a classic look. 

They are narrow and fairly flat, so not a good option if you want a wide fit or high arch support. However, if you are used to something like Chuck Taylor, these will feel like an upgrade. They fit true to size.

In my opinion, the best option on the market for minimalist, low-profile white sneakers.
review.name: The Best

review.reviewBody: I like the look and style. Just wish they came in wide size. Had to order a size larger to fit my wider foot. Popular colors sold out and didn’t get refilled.
review.name: Good shoe, but room for improvement

review.reviewBody: Fit my wide feet extremely well. Comfiest shoes I own.
review.name: Super comfortable, great style

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and stylish.  Only thing I want to point out is the tongue slips often.
review.name: Wonderful shoes!

review.reviewBody: It has a great throwback style with excellent quality and comfort. What more can you want?
review.name: What I expect from Asics

review.reviewBody: First comfortable shoe that I own that’s actually stylish :) perfect for campus and also work as an preschool assistant teacher, I haven’t taken them off
review.name: My favorite shoes :,)

review.reviewBody: I bought these as an upgrade for my yearly Alaska trips and at first I thought they were great.  Unfortunately, after 3-4 long days of wear they started to develop pin hole leaks in the lower legs and stockings.  They seem to have a little less flexibility than I would like and that has probably put stress on the seams.
review.name: Pin Hole Leaks

review.reviewBody: Amazing bang for the buck, there?s just nothing better for the price. BREATHABLE: up to 95 degree Colorado summer one day, without overheating, or too much sweating. DURABLE: with the sonic weld, and extra material on the legs, I don?t worry butt-sliding over rocks on a steep incline. WATERPROOF: Fully waterproof after long days in the river. ORGANIZATION: Many pockets for stuffing topper, phone, keys, floating, fly box, etc. SIZING: You can trust the sizing guide. Know they are slightly bigger for what they show for sizes on the sizing guide, but waders are supposed to be slightly larger. I?m 6?5?, 230lbs with an athletic build, and bigger chest, and I went with LT/LL. I have a 45? chest (which is technically upper limit, and I don?t feel like I?m lacking any room around the chest, can still layer Clothes). Size 12 shoes, and they say the upper limit is 12, and you could honestly have a 13 shoe, and fit just fine. Wonderful wonderful waders in my opinion. You will not regret this purchase! One season so far, and hopefully many more to come!
review.name: Awesome waders, will buy again.

name: Sonic-Pro HD Wader - Men's

description: Buy the Thule DockGrip Kayak Saddle online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: DockGrip Kayak Saddle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule DockGrip Kayak Saddle online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I used the online system to match my vehicle (Genesis GV80) to the appropriate components. Rail and clamp system arrived quickly from Thule, and was easy to install. Great product!
review.name: Perfect Fit

review.reviewBody: I have been wanting this kayak rack for a long time and finally bit the bullet and ordered it. I am so happy that I did!  This is a great kayak rack!  I am a 5’3” woman and I can load my kayak on top of my compact SUV by myself and be ready to roll in about 20 minutes. The dock grip holds my kayak so well that I don’t feel I need to over tighten the cam straps, which is something I felt I had to do with other racks.
review.name: Dock Grip is perfect for my kayak

review.reviewBody: This kayak carrier is excellent. The pads hold the kayak underneath and conform to the shape of the sides. The boat is held very securely.
review.name: Bombproof.

review.reviewBody: It is very difficult to load. Not my kayak and my sup  board stick to the rubber saddles. My old mount was better having felt pads at the rear. Please let me know if there is a fix for this.
review.name: Sticky. Hard to load.

review.reviewBody: They work perfectly for our 13 foot tandum kayak... they also will fit a 2020 Highlander with factory installed cross bars!!! They are sturdy, made well and definitely get the job down!!
review.name: Love them!!

review.reviewBody: Typical of Thule this is a quality product and well engineered. However, the assembly instructions (pictures with no written explanation) are not easily understood and difficult to follow.
review.name: Quality product and well engineered.

review.reviewBody: Installed within like 10 minutes (that’s with the Wingbar Evo, I guess with other racks it could take longer). Used it to transport a large kayak on the highway and felt very secure.
review.name: Easy to install, works well

review.reviewBody: I use it for loading an Ocean fishing kayak on a Chevy Tahoe.   Makes sliding the heavy beast up there very easy and keeps it on track in the center of the vehicle.
review.name: Excellent kayak rack and i would reccoment

review.reviewBody:
Works great...almost too well. ;)  The grip is quite strong, so one must get past the rear carriers as you can't keep sliding your craft from the rear (as in the Dock Glide, which I found too slippery). Would be great to have rear units with a slightly lighter "grip."

I was looking to find an option that would allow me to load my SUP or YAK single handedly. I'm 48 yrs. old with a compromised back.
The addition of the Dock Grip allows me to keep my j hooks when I am loading multiple boats (preferably utilizing them with another set of hands). 
The option to arrange the angle of fhe Dock grips is key for laying my SUP flat and fits my 2019 Pungo hull nearly perfectly. The Dock grips are replacing simple crossbar pads that were not supportive enough of the newer kayak hull shape. So, now I can confidently transport my vessels securely without worrying about denting them.
I would recommend!
review.name: Perfect solution for watercraft flexibility

review.reviewBody: Kayak hauling
review.name: Yes, it seems solid and does a good stable job

name: DockGrip Kayak Saddle

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These shoes are awesome for hiking trails in snow and ice. I feel stable and safe.
review.name: Amazing shoes

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Perfect for winter time, love it, I love the looks, style and very comfortable. Love it..
review.name: I love HOKA

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I'm 70 yrs old and walk my great dane every day in sunny Pennsylvania and am scared to death of falling these spike shoes r so comfy and give me so much confidence I've used them a few times already in the ice and snow and they r awesome
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I'm so glad that I made this purchase. They are pricey but well worth it when the roads are covered with snow and/or ice. Excellent traction and waterproof (for the most part), too. The shoe fits well, and is also great for muddy, sloppy trails without snow. My only beef about the shoes would be the low heel cup; it sits lower than I am used to and that's where the mud/snow/water can seep in. Otherwise, I would highly recommend this shoe to any runner who has to navigate through snow, ice, or mud.
review.name: Hoka Speedgoat GTX Spike saves the day when it snows!

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The time from ordering and getting the shipment was normal. But the shoes were a present and once opened discovered the pair is too big. Im giving only 4 stars because I have been trying for a couple hours to do an exchange on the website. I answered a few questions and then the next page is blank and says "429 Too Many Requests". Kinda disappointing.
review.name: Ordering and Shipping is good

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: At last a shoe for Michigan black ice !! I wear Rockets in spring and summer...love those shoes
review.name: Spikes Waterproof and winter running

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These would've been great to walk outside in the icy weather conditions. The knot on the stitching (and possibly show glue) on one side of the tongue on one of the shoes would rub on the top of my foot when I walked. I don't know if it was just this particular pair and considered exchanging for the same, but didn't want to chance it. I wish Hoka would make the comfortable padded tongues like they have on the Bondi 7 and consider placing these cleats on some of their other styles.
review.name: Has potential but had a few flaws

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am so happy that HOKA has small sized shoes!!! So hard to find size 5 wide. The speed goat GTX spiked shoe however does not come in wide but...I sized up a half size to 5.5 so I can wear heavy winter sox and the shoe fits perfectly, has a good array of spikes and so far has worked well. Good thickness in the sole and insoles, my feet did not get cold in the recent steep hike I did at 18 degrees F and gripped the frozen ground well, except in glare ice where even Kahtoola's were not gripping. I am happy with this shoe
review.name: SpeedGoat 5 GTX Spiked Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Overall, this is a good shoe. It does fit true to size in length, but the heel cup is too big for my heel. I've not had that problem with any shoe before so I feel like my foot is a standard foot. My heel comes up when I walk. I tried the runner's loop with it to keep my heel down. It made a little difference, but not much. I do have a pair of Speedgoat 5's and I don't have the heel cup problem with those. The spikes on the shoe are fantastic. They have been working well for me on slippery/muddy terrain. The shoe itself needs to be a bit lower or a bit higher at the ankle for me as it rubs my ankles wrong. I'd love to see this shoe as a high top for the ankle support. I've been wearing them in wet terrain and in the rain and my feet have remained dry.
review.name: Good, but could be better

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I very much like the Hoka brand. Really comfortable for trail runs and hikes. The only problem I have is it's nearly impossible to wear gaiters because of the way the leasing structure is. Please hook up! Figure out how trail runners can wear gaiters with your shoes
review.name: Love them, but...

name: Speedgoat 5 GTX Spike Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody:
As an adult I have a small foot so always looking for shoes that don't look kiddish with pink and purple or with hearts and stars.  This shoe has an adult look.  Maybe it is the vanity in me.  

The shoe is slightly heavy and is not very flexible.  Because it does not flex so easily, it feels like it can slip at the heel.  I have learned a slightly thicker sock is a better fit with the shoes. A thin sock feels like it can slip.   I can deal with it since I do like the look of the shoe. Maybe with time they will break in.  

I could do without the red strip on the back of the shoe, ehhh... I don't see it.   It is worth checking them out if like me with small feet, you want a shoe that is casual for an adult look.   True to size.
review.name: Worth buying if.....
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Purchased for my grandson, 2nd pair. Warm, comfortable.
review.name: QUALITY & COMFORT
comment: Thanks for sharing your feedback Dave!

review.reviewBody: Bought this same shoes for my son when he was much younger and he loved them a lot. As a toddler at the time, I preferred unlaced shoes for him during the winter and nothing too heavy, so he could still run around comfortably. I got this same ones again now that he is a little bigger and he can’t wait to wear them. I got them a little big so they can last at least the whole winter.
review.name: 2nd pair

review.reviewBody: Awesome shoe. Comfortable. Great shoe for active boys
review.name: Awesome shoe

review.reviewBody: I wear these for almost everything, daily for work, hiking, gardening, around the house.  Only times I pick something different is for the gym or pool. With daily use (8000 steps) they last about a year to a year and a half.
review.name: Shoes for almost everything

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, durable, supportive, waterproof! Great for winter and wet weather.
review.name: Love!
comment: Thank you for the great review!

review.reviewBody: My kid would live in these if he could. We are on his third pair (so far). They are comfy, durable, versatile -can’t ask for much more.
review.name: Kid’s 3rd pair!
comment: Awesome! Thanks for choosing Merrell!

review.reviewBody: This is the 5th or 6th pair of these same shoes that I have bought. This pair fits differently than previous pairs. They are narrower in the toe box and the back/heel flip off my foot when I walk.
review.name: The shoe has changed
comment: We are sorry to hear these didn't work out for you. We would always recommend to not wear and return immediately if the footwear does not fit. We are unable to accept returns of used footwear. If you have any questions please give the team a call at 800-288-3124.

review.reviewBody: Hopefully they will eventually offer these in a wide size. They are as narrow as italian pepper dress shoes. Otherwise, we love the design and ease of use.
review.name: Wow are these narrow....

review.reviewBody: Right shoes was stretched out so badly it was ridiculous. Can’t believe it made it through an inspection and actually shipped to a customer. Waste of my time and money.
review.name: No quality control whatsoever

description: Buy the Edelrid Giga Jul Belay Device online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Giga Jul Belay Device
hasVariant.description: Buy the Edelrid Giga Jul Belay Device online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I lead belay with it exclusively. Outdoors I've used it for rapping single & double strands and as an ascension backup in Auto mode cleaning lower anchors where I've had to rap down to them. It takes a couple of sessions to learn how and when to use the modes but once you've gotten over the learning curve this guy is fantastic. It does provide a little more friction than a grigri or ATC when paying out slack even in M but it's not a deal breaker and it's still my go to for belay & two stranded rap applications.
review.name: I love this little gem

review.reviewBody: As a lefty, I find it hard to lead belay with a grigri, but still want some assisted breaking, so I’ve embraced the ATC Pilots (or similar) of the world. But then I need to bring a tuber to repel. This one trick pony can replace all of your belay devices, and it does a good job of it. My only beef is that playing out slack isn’t as smooth as I would like, but I am hopeful that with more use the device will wear in a bit, or I’ll get better and more comfortable using it.
review.name: So close… but overall 4.5

review.reviewBody:
This is a gem that does it all!

It replaced my ATC and while I mostly only rappel with it, I like knowing that it can belay and rap in assisted mode in case I drop my autoblock cord or my grigri.
review.name: Almost the perfect belay/rappel device

review.reviewBody: This is a really neat device, which I have found particularly useful for multipitch. I often want to bring both a grigri, for the safety when belaying either on lead or guide, and a classic tube in case i need to rap, or if i need to make an autoblocking system that can take two strands. If the route is bolted, this isn't a huge issue ? but if you also have a double rack and a backpack, it gets a little onerous to have all that weight on your harness. This device takes the place of both! I find the bite reasonably tight, and while I'm still getting used to it, paying out slack is fairly easy too. Solid, versatile device, for a reasonable price!
review.name: Versatile and Efficient

name: Giga Jul Belay Device

description: Buy the Santa Cruz Bicycles 5010 C GX Eagle Transmission Reserve Mountain Bike online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 5010 C GX Eagle Transmission Reserve Mountain Bike
hasVariant.description: Buy the Santa Cruz Bicycles 5010 C GX Eagle Transmission Reserve Mountain Bike online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: 5010 C GX Eagle Transmission Reserve Mountain Bike
review.reviewBody:
I'll admit I was mixed wheel curious but hesitant to move away from the 29in trail bikes I've become accustomed to. Last minute I decided to give this 5010 a try and instantly fell in love with the way it rides. 

The 5010 has always been one of the most playful bikes in the Santa Cruz range and this newest version is no exception. The 29in wheel up front aids in better rollover and adds additional traction when cornering and braking. The 27.5in wheel out back brings the party and is eager to whip around a tight turn or mid air for some style points. The smaller wheel out back makes a noticeable difference when riding super steep fall-line trails where getting the rear wheel out of the way is ideal for traction and composure. 

I may have been skeptical of mixed wheel bikes but after riding and owning this one I'm sold. This bike is super playful, plenty efficient for long days in the saddle, and offers all the capability I need in a trail bike. If you're mixed wheel curious I encourage you to get out on a MX bike and see if it's for you, too.
review.name: Playful Ride

name: 5010 C GX Eagle Transmission Reserve Mountain Bike

description: Buy the Lezyne Super Pro GPS Pro Loaded Bike Computer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Super Pro GPS Pro Loaded Bike Computer
hasVariant.description: Buy the Lezyne Super Pro GPS Pro Loaded Bike Computer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Super Pro GPS Pro Loaded Bike Computer
review.reviewBody:
The equipment works well in its functionalities. Sometimes the GPS does not pick up a signal or it takes several minutes and it is necessary to restart the module.

After 1 year of use, the main problem is that the sensors and supports are of very poor quality and resistance.
The rubber bands to hold the cadence sensor cut off after a few days and you lose the sensor.
The plastic ears where the rubber bands are attached to the sensor break easily and you lose the sensor. (see photos)
The internal system that holds the battery caps, dries out and breaks, leaving the cap
without sustenance. The plastic grooves that hold the cover are broken (see photo in the first battery change).
The sensor filled with moisture inside and broke.
In conclusion, an investment that, because it is cheap, has been very expensive.
review.name: Poor quality of materials on sensors

name: Super Pro GPS Pro Loaded Bike Computer

description: Buy the Platypus GravityWorks 6.0L Replacement Reservoir Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: GravityWorks 6.0L Replacement Reservoir Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Platypus GravityWorks 6.0L Replacement Reservoir Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Awesome system!!! The clean bags double as really great longer distance water containers (IE kayaking for a few days with no fresh water available..) can you pretty please sell them in 4L and 6L with caps??? Much more trustworthy than the "Platy bag" with the seal along its length. You might even make the bags so the caps attach with a tether, they're very easily to lose in the field.
review.name: Great products - PLEASE SELL THE CLEAN TANKS AND CAPS!!!

review.reviewBody: Hands down the best water filter I’ve ever used in 30 years of drinking from backcountry streams and lakes. It’s miraculously easy to set up, walk away and the next time you glance at it you have four liters of clean, clear, and tasteless water. My only gripe is why can’t the Clean reservoir have the same wide zip-loc opening as the Dirty reservoir to allow easier drying and cleaning? The little soda cap opening on the Clean reservoir doesn’t allow enough air exchange to permit proper drying in less than 2 days, promoting mildew growth and more frequent cleaning, which is also a pain because of the small opening. So close to five stars, but not quite.
review.name: Difficult to dry

review.reviewBody:
Great system but there is evidently some product quality issues that make it through as noted with some of these reviews. For me, the Clean bag has delaminated along one side of the hard threaded plastic. This results in water spraying everywhere when filling directly from the Clean bag, or newly filtered water leaking out of the Clean bag if it is being filled from the filter line at certain angles.

Also as noted by others, I hear nothing back from the Cascade Designs warranty team after filling out about one form per year. I wouldn't complain about purchasing it a new bag if it were more reasonably priced.
review.name: Seam Failure

review.reviewBody: I love the system, but the receiving reservoir is just a waste of money and resources. I filter directly into clean Platypus water bags (1 and 2 liter). You should sell just the “dirty” reservoir with a Platypus connector below the filter on the outlet hose.
review.name: Sell the “dirty” reservoir only as an option

name: GravityWorks 6.0L Replacement Reservoir Kit

review.itemreviewed: Lofoten Thermal Pro Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great value , efficient warmth
review.name: Very comfortable , nice fit !

review.itemreviewed: Lofoten Thermal Pro Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I loved this so much after a couple weeks of wear I bought a second one in another color. It really is my favorite mid-layer and I have a bit of an issue with picking up mid-layers, I wear something like this virtually every single day except the hottest times of summer. I have Patagonia, Helly Hansen, Black Diamond, Melanzana, Mountain Hardware and probably some others midlayer, quarter zips for active wear and this is far an away my favorite. The asymettrical zip and hood design is very comfortable and warm without being too constrictive or awkward, it's warmer than it's weight suggests and it's good at dumping heat. Good pocket space in the front pockets and I like the internal divider in the chest pocket. It also looks fairly unique and nice, a few of my friends have asked where they can get one. Really well designed. Definitely on the slimmer side for people used to American sizing but I'd still say true to size. I don't think it's very forgiving for people who might have a bit of a stomach though.
review.name: My Favorite mid-layer/fleece

review.itemreviewed: Lofoten Thermal Pro Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: As a mid layer this is great.  Very soft with snug fit.  Material feels almost like cotton, but dries fast.  Been using it for outdoor runs in the mid 30s and it’s perfect.  The one complaint I would have is that the quarter zip is off-center.  Meaning that the chest zipper is slightly right of your chest center.  It’s irritating and it feels like its an odd fit at first
review.name: Great mid layer

review.itemreviewed: Lofoten Thermal Pro Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Soft, comfortable and warm.  Looks incredible, love the offset zipper design.  Highly technical but just at home on the apres scene. Snug enough to prevent bunching but remains enough room to move freely.  Hood is also a nice option. Kangaroo pocket stows things comfortably.  A great addition to any wardrobe.
review.name: Excellent Mid-Layer

review.itemreviewed: Lofoten Thermal Pro Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good mid-layer article. Works well with a very close fitting base layer, but anything more and it becomes a bit tight. Only thing that is a bit odd is the ribbed material on the sleeves. It tends to snag and you have to be careful with any velcro that might be on your outer shell.  Quality product from a quality brand.
review.name: Respectable Mid-Layer

name: Lofoten Thermal Pro Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is a great top.  Relatively seamless, nice and long to cover my waist and some of my booty, athletic fit (not billowing) but not suffocating, warm but not itchy wool.  It's my go-to first layer for winter running.  Maybe one other layer over it, or maybe two, depending on the weather.  It's always perfect, wicking just right.  I have lots of trouble with winter running, with the first layer almost always getting sweaty and clammy and then as soon as the wind blows or I start to cool down, making me really cold.  What great value, too.  (Note:  I got one of the tanks - a different story altogether ...too tight, a strange tight band at the bottom that only rides up and around everywhere.)
review.name: Great baselayer for winter running

review.reviewBody: Needed a nice warm, light and functional puffy in my mountain wardrobe - boy did I make the right choice. I have access to all the big brands being a professional ski coach and mountain athlete but boy I'm glad I went with the Terra Peak! Very warm, stretchy, soft, looks great and when the jacket is fully zipped, the collar and hood sit perfectly and traps the warmth. Genius. It doesn't suffocate you when active, breathes well. I had it on with some light drizzle and the shizzle was just sheeting right off - at least for now while it's new so hopefully it lasts for a while like that. Only wished it had a brushed interior on the pockets (like the collar) and a cinch cord on the bottom for a little extra protection. I am 5'6 160lb, athletic and the small fits perfect allowing for a great mid-layer or day to day wear. I would strongly encourage giving this jacket a try if you're torn between the Nano, Pinion Hoody and other similar jackets.
review.name: Quality warmth and functionality in a superlight puffy!

review.reviewBody: First of all I really want to like this coat. The color options are great and the feel is amazing. The Quantam Pertex material with Thermoball insulation is a great pairing and feels incredibly comfortable. However that being said I already own a Thermoball coat which is slim fit as well as a Breithorn down coat, also slim fit which make them both great options for midlayers. This coat is standard fit which makes it baggy and a little bulky under my shell. Additionally the hood is designed for use with a helmet, however I probably wouldn't use this coat as a standalone when doing cold weather sports so it's too big without having any way to adjust it. Overall this really does seem like a nice coat if you don't want to spend the extra money to buy a Breithorn, however I just couldn't quite find the right use for it with the other TNF products offerings that I already have and really love.
review.name: Overall Nice Coat

review.reviewBody: Great fit. Very light. Exactly as advertised. I wish there were more colors.
review.name: Love this jacket.

review.reviewBody: Returned terra peak hoodie as the material under the arms is paper thin and too easy to rip. Frankly, I didn’t see this jacket making it thru even one season of wear!
review.name: Material under arms is thin

name: Terra Peak Hoodie - Men's

review.reviewBody: A good fit and comfortable.The rubber sole is different than a felt sole.It took some getting used to on slippery river rocks but was fine overall.
review.name: Good Buy

review.reviewBody: The boot is fairly lightweight and rugged. Very simple boot without much to it. Fits true to size and is able to lace up securely. Not as stiff as most other wading boots. I like that it has the metal rivets along the eyelights for the laces. These boots appear as if they were made to last. I would recommend this boot to others. It was a tad bulkier than what it appears in the picture, but not excessively so. Fits well with a lot of good support. Easy to walk in for a long day of fishing.
review.name: Simple, Solid Boot for a reasonable price.

review.reviewBody:
Fit great easy to get on and off. I have mobility and flexibility issues and was able to tie them with no difficulty. Wore them for 7 hrs in 44 Degree water my feet were warm all day long.
I need a cane to walk and these bots gave me an added to my ability to wade in more rocket water.
review.name: P. devine

review.reviewBody: Used this back packing last August. It rained hard the way in which was a four hour hike. I was soaked to the bone. It is not very water proof at all. Besides that I like it but for that reason it is not going to be good for much other than a wind breaker.
review.name: Not very water proof

review.reviewBody: Bought this for a trip to Scandinavia and Japan. Light weight and very useful when it rained. Lots of great pockets. Great design
review.name: Great design

review.reviewBody: Really wanted to love this, but it wet out in 20 minutes all three decent rains I took it in. For the cost and the weight, that's ridiculous. The hood design is bad unless it's zipped all the way up; if the neck zipper is left down, the flaps stick out enough to funnel rain down onto your chest. For what it's worth, the pocket/side vent setup is right where it needs to be.
review.name: Not Great

review.reviewBody: I’ve work these on hikes and for indoor classes and love them. They are a little thin and as others have said, no gusset. But overall they are great. The swirly color is super fun too.
review.name: Great lightweight leggings

review.reviewBody: First time buying Patagonia pants. They felt amazing - super soft! However, I returned them because I didn't like the overall look. I was hoping they would be thicker. I thought that is what the 7/8 meant - I could be wrong. I am picking when it comes to leggings. I don't like it when the leggings reflect your body's wrinkles and outlines... if that makes sense. Don't let me review persuade you not to buy. I think I am in the minority when it comes to legging wishes and expectations. I'll certainly try patagonia again.
review.name: I wanted to love them

review.reviewBody: The gusset is defective and the front seam reaches all the way into the crotch accentuating anything going on down there.
review.name: Camel toe city

review.reviewBody: Bought these on sale hoping my wife would like them. She loves the overall fit, feel and function of these leggings!
review.name: Wife loves these!

review.reviewBody: These leggings seem nice, but there is no crotch gusset.  They are comfortable and seem like they would be great for running, but unfortunately I can't wear them in public because they show EVERYTHING.  I own several other pairs of running tights in the same size that don't cause this issue, including another pair of Patagonia tights in the same size that also have no crotch gusset, and I've had no issues with those other pairs.   Maybe these run extra small, but they feel true to size.  They should have a crotch gusset regardless.   I'm super bummed but I'll have to return them.
review.name: No Gusset

review.reviewBody: These tights fit me perfectly and are extremely comfortable. I bought a small (I'm 5'7", 120 lbs).  They are great for cold weather trail running, errands around town, and gym workouts.  They hug your legs (they don't sag) and I love the softness of the material. I'd definitely buy them again in a different color (hint, hint).
review.name: Great Tights!

name: Maipo 7/8 Tight - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this for my birthday as I am becoming an avid runner. I love camelback products and my husband, having been in the military swears by camelback products as they were issued them. Upon arrival, my hose seemed to have some superficial exterior damage. The first time I used the bladder, it leaked on my run. I chalked it up to user error. On the second attempt to try to use it, it appears there is a leak in the bladder itself. 

I hope I can get a replacement bladder as this one appears to be defective. But all in all I love the pack. The size is perfect, the pockets are great, comfortable. If the bladder had no issues I would have given this likely a 5-star review. I have reached out to customer service.

Jackie
review.name: Love the pack, bladder not so much.

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for something smaller than my 3L Camelbak Ratchet for my daily commute to work. The Repurpose seemed like a good fit with a 1.5 L capacity. However when I tried it on, this is more suited for a child. 
Same quality as my Ratchet but if you?re an adult, don?t get this.
review.name: Same quality build, however too small

review.reviewBody: See video for high lights on this pack.

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket caught my eye because of its' bright colors and classic, yet uniquely new design. I love the bugaboo embroidery on the back as well. But the biggest selling point for me with this jacket is its' versatility. I am easily kept warm in New York winter with the full coat, but on days when it's milder, I love that I can easily just take off the blue outer shell and only use the inner piece -- which is also a great stand alone jacket. 
It fits true to size and looks like how it does on the website. I'm 5'3" and 135 lbs and bought a Medium and it fits great. Not oversized or too tight anywhere. But it is form fitting. So if you like a baggier look and feel, I'd go up a size. 
The quality of material and the zippers is excellent, and it's really easy to put the jacket back together if you choose to separate the layers. 
The only things that would make this jacket better for me is if there was a hood for the rain/snow, although the high neck helps a lot. Aside from that I wish the zippers didn't zip from the bottom up in case something falls out; but to be fair, nothing has fallen out before.
review.name: My favorite coat <3

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I live in South Florida. I needed something warm for Thanksgiving in Connecticut. The holiday is next. I have received the jacket and it looks great on me. I suspect that it will keep me warm in Hartford.
review.name: A Great Fit

name: Bugaboo II 1986 Interchange 3-in-1 Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this as a softshell to wear over my fleeces or puffer jackets. I have worn it quite a lot since I purchased it and it's fantastic. This shell works perfect over a fleece and/or puffer when it's 30-50* F. This would be a fantastic light jacket to wear in the spring/fall/summer as well. It does a pretty good job at repelling rain although as most know I would not use this for heavy rains. But in the PNW mist/drizzle it does great. 

The only thing to know is it runs small, and by small I mean very small. I have worn a Medium on everything for 20 years, and if I didn't want to layer under-neath I would rock a Medium in this. However, with a puffer or fleece, or even a flannel under-neath I got a large. I am 6'0-6'1 and 175lbs. I ended up buying a Medium and Large to make sure one fit and I am going to keep both. The medium I'll wear in the summer as a stand alone jacket and the Large I am wearing all winter.
review.name: Excellent Lightweight Softshell

review.reviewBody: Lightweight material with excellent stretch. Fit is true to size and with the hood up visibility is still good.
review.name: Lightweight material with excellent stretch.

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, stretchy, big pockets in the right place, breathable and windproof. Well designed hood, 4 season use. Recommend
review.name: Brilliant garment

review.reviewBody: I've had friends much more experienced in the outdoors put me on to Rab's Borealis. This is an extremely versatile, lightweight jacket perfect for fast and light missions in the Mountains. I've used it as a layer for climbing and it fits comfortably with a harness. The jacket is made of a material that's flexes and moves with you allowing for great range of motion in the shoulders. I've climbed on plenty of rock variation and its held up to the abrasion and abuse at camp. Looking forward to many more years of adventure with this jacket.
review.name: The Borealis Delivers

review.reviewBody: Bought the jacket approximately 6 months ago, fit is good (38 chest and size medium), lightweight, breathable, good amount of stretch making if comfortable and packs down reasonably compact. I've worn it perhaps a dozen times for short trips to and from the office when weather has looked unfavourable. Today it rained (not what I would describe as hard), and although I was only out for about ten minutes my shirt and shoulders were soaked, also down the inside of my arms where the jacket flexes. Slightly disappointed considering the matrix fabric is described as providing weather protection and in Q&A below the jacket is described as water resistant. I accept it isn't a water-proof jacket but I'd expect more protection for the odd shower than what the jacket provided.
review.name: Water resistant it is not

review.reviewBody: Great trousers, light, comfortable but also surprisingly warm.
review.name: Great trousers, light, comfortable but

review.reviewBody: Had been hoping you would release this in XS. Jacket is a perfect fit (1.70m, 60kg). Material is really comfortable. Ink colour is nice, but would buy again if you offered a more “hi-vis” shade in the smallest size.
review.name: Finally XS size!

review.reviewBody: Used with thermal vest and Nexus fleece it provided excellent layering so much so I bought a second one.
review.name: Used with thermal vest and

review.reviewBody: One of the best pieces of kit I have bought in a long while.
review.name: One of the best pieces

review.reviewBody: Extremely light and windproof jacket, close fitting in size.
review.name: Extremely light and windproof jacket,

name: Borealis Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I'll quote my climbing partner's reaction to the first round of using these lil' dudes, "They're like the sports car of quickdraws." 

I have had such good experiences with DMM biners that I sprung for a dozen of these when it was time to freshen the sport rack. Crazy smooth clipping and unclipping on both the gear and rope end. They seem burly and I suspect they will pass the test of time. The gear end of the dogbone has a nice play to it, good for clipping bolts or cams. They probably won't be coming into the backcountry with me, but for any cragging a few of these will be on the gear sling.
review.name: Yes, they clip as good as they look.

name: Alpha VW Sport Quickdraw

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) Love that hat. No bad reviews from my son. I bought it to keep the sun off my my son. Doing a great job. I think it's kinda warm. It has a fleece like lining.
review.name: Protecting my ginger from the rays

review.reviewBody: The XS/S was too small for my son. He wears a bicycle helmet, size XS, with a range of 19.5"-21.25". He has to tighten down the adjuster on his helmet, so I figured he was on the smaller end of that range. This hat in XS/S indicates sizing from 18.5"-20", but it did not fit him even when we maxxed out the adjuster. The M/L sizing choice for this hat starts at 21", but I didn't want this falling over his eyes while he's paddling/hiking/etc, which is why I chose the smaller size. So, if you're in between sizes, size up!
review.name: Sizing didn't line up

review.reviewBody: Good-looking, very practical hat for sunny or wet weather. Adjustable means a perfect fit.
review.name: Kids' Seattle Sombrero

review.reviewBody: Super hat. My daughter loves it. Keeps her head dry and warm. Daugher is 20 months with a big head and XS gits good
review.name: Super hat

review.reviewBody: It's a great hat except my sons heat gets very hot on warmer days.
review.name: Great hat

review.reviewBody: Bought for my son to wear when we are out on the water. He loves it and it looks really good on him.
review.name: Works great to keep sun out of kids eyes

review.reviewBody: Excellent quality, with adjustable strap at the back for sizing. The lanyard is good and Velcro in convenient locations to fold the sides. It would be good to have a place to store the lanyard/strap when not in use.
review.name: Excellent Hat for children

review.reviewBody: I have adult version and got this for my daughters birthday. The best all-around rain hat made!
review.name: The best

review.reviewBody: I bought it for my 1.5 year old son at the L/XL size. Just be careful that this size while it sounds large probably won't fit toddlers beyond 3 years old. It is true to outdoor research's waterproof ability but it is lined inside which makes it hot on a day warmer than 20 C. Kids tend to run around so a hat gets warm fast. I would bring a separate sun hat for sunny days with no rain and save this one for wet days.
review.name: Waterproof but does get hot

review.reviewBody: This sun hat was purchased for my youngest son, he is very sensitive to light and this hat helps shade him for the sunlight that irritates his eyes.
review.name: Does it's job!

name: Seattle Rain Hat - Kids'

review.reviewBody: This pullover fleece is unbelievably warm and cozy. I have 4 of them, all in beautiful colors. They wash and dry perfectly and come out looking like new.
review.name: Love! Love!

review.itemreviewed: Teca Fleece Pullover - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: A great warm piece, but I'm a standard medium and found the width of the chest. . . . just odd. Tight. So, I returned it. Somewhat unflattering. I also didn't love that the pockets, which I'd prefer to be soft fleece, were lined with nylon or poly. Burr. . .
review.name: Oddly sized

review.itemreviewed: Teca Fleece Pullover - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: I stopped wearing fleece for awhile due to it attracting so much dog hair. But I really liked this pullover and wanted another layering piece and it was on sale and I am so glad I did. It’s very comfortable and warm and the dog hair doesn’t stick to it!
review.name: Cozy fleece that stays clean!

review.itemreviewed: Teca Fleece Pullover - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought for a gift and my mom says it’s soft and really comfortable.
review.name: Super warm and cozy

review.itemreviewed: Teca Fleece Pullover - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: Overall a fair product though not as well fitting and comfortable as expected. Compared to Patagonia or Northface not quite as form fitting and comfortable as the competitors. Also the chest area is not designed for a large bust even at large size. Very tight at the bust and very loose at the waist. Maybe a slight redesign would be helpful with more custom fit.
review.name: Fit & Finish not as expected

review.itemreviewed: Teca Fleece Pullover - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the color, but the fabric is stiff and the sizing is very big and boxy. I would have returned, but bought on a sale. The colors are pretty, but it’s not flattering at all.
review.name: Beautiful color

review.itemreviewed: Teca Fleece Pullover - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am super happy about my recent purchase. The feel of the fleece and overall construction are excellent. The fit is great as well. The length is fantastic! It covers the waistline even when doing overhead work.
review.name: Quality construction and great feel.

review.itemreviewed: Teca Fleece Pullover - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: Fits true to size. My only compliant is that it is 2-3” longer in the body than I would like it. I am 5’8” but have an average length torso. This would NOT work well for petites.

review.itemreviewed: 24oz Wide Mouth Trail Lightweight Flex Cap Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: so i bought this one intending to love it. it's the perfect color and looks so sleek. despite the review to follow i really liked the bottle. however, it does not keep drinks cold or warm. when i fill it with ice first thing in the morning it was completely gone by the end of day, and all my other hydroflasks kept ice frozen for days. so i tried it for my coffee, hoping maybe i'd be able to use it for that. nope, I heat up my coffee to scalding first thing in the am and then pour it in there, within 4 hours it was tepid, usually it stays hot/very warm til mid afternoon. so to sum it up, i want to love it, but it does not work as good as the regular hydroflasks.

review.reviewBody:
First, I'm not sure why this in the Men's Balaclavas & Neck Gaiters category. it is clearly a women's item. It may work for a man, but definitely designed for women. I ordered the "camo print". What is seen on my screen is a lovely light olive, greige, and aqua blue camo pattern. Cute, right? That is not what I received. I received traditional camo colors - dark olive, tan, black, and brown.  I looked at the company's website - it shows both the traditional camo and the camo with the aqua blue. I sent backcountry a head's up email about needing to change the picture to accurately depict the item, I got a "hey, thanks!" back and a week later the photo hasn't changed. I also emailed the company and have received no response.
The thing about this experience, while it is not a great experience and this is a pricey item for what it is, it is a very useful, warm, and most effective item of this type. I live in a climate that can get very, very cold, but stays sunny (at high elevation). For dog walks, I can throw on a baseball cap (to shield the sun) and have this on and it fits up over my ears and stays put on the back of my head. I don't have a gaiter that does that - they stretch out and fall down. I haven't tried it for skiing yet, but I'm sure I will love it too. It is warm and soft on the inside. It truly is a useful item if you are someone who finds themselves outside regularly.  I do wish Backcountry would've offered me a discount on the item I received as it is not pictured.
review.name: Item - 5 stars, wrong photo depiction

name: Pullover

review.reviewBody:
I absolutely adore these shoes. They are a perfect combination of ease, comfort, and stability. Firstly, I almost always wear slip-ons. I've tried many pairs of slip-on sneakers. So that's the first plus, that they're slip-ons. 

Second, I have problem feet in a way, in that I have neuropathy. I'm also a little bit unstable due to a leg injury. The shoes were a little bit painful to put on at first because of the neuropathy because they are quite snug without being too small (wouldn't be a problem for people without neuropathy). But after wearing them for a couple of months it's not a problem. The positive side of the snugness is that they make me feel really stable. I am always thinking about how nice my feet feel and how I don't worry about tripping or wobbling. I took them as my primary shoes to Iceland (we were not doing a lot of nature activities but were doing walking). They were perfect for that. I felt very secure walking around. It's actually amazing that they aren't lace-up.

I recommend the waterproofing if you're needing to be in rain or watery environments. Zero water on my feet on several rainy days in Iceland. They are warm too - I live in Minnesota and do not have cold feet at all, even when wearing without socks in winter which I'm wont to do. 

The grip is great. Again, I feel very secure. You will still slip on shiny ice if you walk on it though, as I found out, but I didn't think any kind of rubber sole will prevent slippage on that kind of ice.

They also look nice, and do not show very much wear. I think they got a little bit darker since I bought them (I got a light tan color) but they still look great. I wasn't expecting that with suede.

I am thinking about buying a pair or two more and am looking at the cozy version for winter. A+!
review.name: Best shoes

review.reviewBody: Great shoe. My criteria was light weight, easy slip on and good arch support. These are so good I bought a second pair.
review.name: Excellent casual shoes

review.reviewBody: They are ok but not as comfortable as my old Jungle Moc's in style or fit.
review.name: They are OK

comment: Thank you for sharing your review with us!

review.reviewBody: I needed a pair of slip on shoes when I was having back surgery ten years ago. I bought a pair of Jungle Mocs and I've been buying them ever since.
review.name: My Go-to shoe
comment: Thank you for your awesome feedback!

review.reviewBody: I had bad feet for years and couldn't walk more than a few hundred feet without pain making me turn back, I bought my first pair of these last year and haven't looked back since. My feet don't hurt and I regularly walk a mile every morning now!
review.name: Foot fixers

name: Jungle Moc Shoe - Men's
